result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two and four. Credit for 110  days.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two and three. Credit for 110  days.

Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Susan Q.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 1/2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNTS 2, 3 and 4, with credit for 100 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 3 1/2 years of sentence.  
-Restitution set at $50.00 payable to Danny B. joint and several with co-defendants on cases 15CF808, 15CF809, 15CF810 and 15CF811
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable out of cash bail on deposit.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge payable out of cash bail on deposit. 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Defendant to cooperate with a risk/needs assessment
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-No contact with co-actors, victims Marquis M., Daniel B., Jonathan B. and Harry N.  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Packet of documents from Sweet and Associates dated December 1, 2015 to be sent to the Wisconsin State Prison system

Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin. documents of support for defendant, received and filed
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in court with Attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Patrick J Anderson, appearing for Ronald Dague, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Counts 1, 2, 3 and 4:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.  
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

No PSI ordered.  Bail to continue as previously set.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is here for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Defense does wish to address bail.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail received and filed.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in custody.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Emily G., Jonathan B., Harry N., Marquis M., Daniel B., Kimberly Meyer, Adalberto Hernandez, Lori Wilbur, or Nicholas Wells.

Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Anthony Lee Zydzik in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
